Class Automaton

  • java.lang.Object
    • Automaton

  • public class Automaton
extends java.lang.Object
    A class used to create Elementary Cellular Automata using a collection of classes. Automata class is used to create and evolve the Elementary Cellular Automata as well as get various information.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Riley Draper

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private boolean[] currentStateArray
      A boolean array that holds the current state using true and false values.
      private java.lang.String currentStateString
      A string that holds the current generation.
      private Rule ecaRule
      Uses the rule class to store the rule which defines the cellular automata.
      private char falseSymbol
      The false symbol.
      private java.lang.String generationsString
      A String that contains all the evolutions on separate lines.
      private Generation initGeneration
      A Generation type that contains the current generation of cellular automata.
      private boolean[] initState
      A boolean array used to set the initial state of the "Zero" evolution.
      private int ruleNum
      The number from 0 to 255 that determines the evolutionary pattern of the Automata.
      private int steps
      A counter that keeps track of the total steps.
      private char trueSymbol
      The true symbol.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Automaton(int ruleNum, boolean[] initState)
      Constructor which initializes an automata using a rule and an array of type boolean representing the initial state of generation zero.
      Automaton(java.lang.String filename)
      Creates an automata using information from a file.

    • Field Detail

      • falseSymbol

        private char falseSymbol
        The false symbol. Can be chosen.

      • trueSymbol

        private char trueSymbol
        The true symbol. Can be chosen.

      • ruleNum

        private int ruleNum
        The number from 0 to 255 that determines the evolutionary pattern of the Automata.

      • initState

        private boolean[] initState
        A boolean array used to set the initial state of the "Zero" evolution. True is black, false is white.

      • steps

        private int steps
        A counter that keeps track of the total steps.

      • generationsString

        private java.lang.String generationsString
        A String that contains all the evolutions on separate lines.

      • currentStateString

        private java.lang.String currentStateString
        A string that holds the current generation. Currently unused.

      • currentStateArray

        private boolean[] currentStateArray
        A boolean array that holds the current state using true and false values. True is black, false is white.

      • initGeneration

        private Generation initGeneration
        A Generation type that contains the current generation of cellular automata.

      • ecaRule

        private Rule ecaRule
        Uses the rule class to store the rule which defines the cellular automata.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Automaton

        public Automaton(int ruleNum,
                 boolean[] initState)
        Constructor which initializes an automata using a rule and an array of type boolean representing the initial state of generation zero.
        Parameters:
        ruleNum - the rule number from 0 to 255 that dictates the behavior of the automata
        initState - initial state of the zero generation

      • Automaton

        public Automaton(java.lang.String filename)
          throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                 java.io.IOException
        Creates an automata using information from a file.
        Parameters:
        filename - the name of the file including the file extension
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - thrown if file cannot be opened
        java.io.IOException - thrown if Scanner cannot be used
